dict.string: This workflow will allow you to use Alfred to keep track of time on each of your projects.
"today"=today's time sheet, "yesterday"=yesterdays time sheet, "YY-MM-DD"=time sheet for that day.

echo <<<HEREDOC Keyword Description ------- ----------- atkhelp This help screen
atkgui A simple graphical interface for viewing times.
addproject Allows you to add a project for time keeping.
removeproject Allows you to remove a project. It will list the project that can be removed.
setproject Allows you to set the project to keep time for. It will list the different projects.
currentproject Displays the time of current project and it's status.
timekeeper This allows you to turn the timer on or off. It will prompt for which one you want.
worktime This will display the time worked on the current project. you specify the day. You can use 'today' and 'yesterday'.
vweek This will display the current project's time for the current week.
vmonth This will display the current project's time for the current month. HEREDOC;
View the time this week for the current project.
Remove a project for the list

#Original Author : Camilo Olarte|colarte@telesat.com.co|Sept.2003 # Modification Author: Richard Guay - raguay@customct.com | Feb 2013 # # Program: AlfredTimeKeeper.py # # Description: This program reads the Alfred Time Keeper files and displays the times worked # on each project for that day. I modified the original program tkCalendar to # fit my needs. # import sys, string, calendar import Tkinter import time import string from os.path import expanduser
pathToData = expanduser("~/Library/Application Support/Alfred 2/Workflow Data/com.customct.AlfredTimeKeeper/") year = time.localtime()[0] month = time.localtime()[1] day =time.localtime()[2] strdate = "{}-{:0>2}-{:0>2}".format(str(year),str(month),str(day))
tk = Tkinter
fnta = ("Times", 12) fnt = ("Times", 14) fntc = ("Times", 18, 'bold')
numJobs = 0 try: jobf = open(pathToData + "projects.txt") for job in jobf: numJobs = numJobs + 1
except IOError: numjobs = 1
ATKwidth = numJobs*50 if(ATKwidth < 300): ATKwidth = 300 ATKheight = 200 maxHour = 12 strtitle = "Time Sheet Calendar" strdays = "Mo Tu We Th Fr Sa Su" dictmonths = {'1':'Jan','2':'Feb','3':'Mar','4':'Apr','5':'May', '6':'Jun','7':'Jul','8':'Aug','9':'Sep','10':'Oct','11':'Nov', '12':'Dec'}
def getJobTime(job, date): tm = 0 start = 0 times = 0 try: filename = pathToData + job + "_" + date + ".txt" jtf = open(filename) for jt in jtf: jt = jt.strip() tsp = string.split(jt,":") if(tsp[1] == "start"): start = int(tsp[0]) else: tm = tm + (int(tsp[0]) - start) start = 0 if(start != 0): tm = tm + (time.time() - start) times = tm except IOError: times = 0 return(int(times))
############################################## # BEGIN CLASS class tkCalendar : def __init__ (self, master, arg_year, arg_month, arg_day, arg_parent_updatable_var, update_cmd): self.update_var = arg_parent_updatable_var self.update_cmd = update_cmd top = self.top = master try : self.intmonth = int(arg_month) except: self.intmonth = int(1) self.canvas =tk.Canvas (top, width =ATKwidth, height =ATKheight, relief =tk.RIDGE, background ="white", borderwidth =1) self.canvas.create_rectangle(0,0,303,30, fill="#a4cae8",width=0 ) self.canvas.create_text(150,17, text=strtitle, font=fntc, fill="#2024d6") stryear = str(arg_year)
self.year_var=tk.StringVar() self.year_var.set(stryear) self.lblYear = tk.Label(top, textvariable = self.year_var, font = fnta, background="white") self.lblYear.place(x=135, y = 263)
self.month_var=tk.StringVar() strnummonth = str(self.intmonth) strmonth = dictmonths[strnummonth] self.month_var.set(strmonth)
self.lblYear = tk.Label(top, textvariable = self.month_var, font = fnta, background="white") self.lblYear.place(x=135, y = 283) #Variable muy usada tagBaseButton = "Arrow" self.tagBaseNumber = "DayButton" #draw year arrows x,y = 90, 43 tagThisButton = "leftyear" tagFinalThisButton = tuple((tagBaseButton,tagThisButton)) self.fnCreateLeftArrow(self.canvas, x,y, tagFinalThisButton) x,y = 200, 43 tagThisButton = "rightyear" tagFinalThisButton = tuple((tagBaseButton,tagThisButton)) self.fnCreateRightArrow(self.canvas, x,y, tagFinalThisButton) #draw month arrows x,y = 90, 63 tagThisButton = "leftmonth" tagFinalThisButton = tuple((tagBaseButton,tagThisButton)) self.fnCreateLeftArrow(self.canvas, x,y, tagFinalThisButton) x,y = 200, 63 tagThisButton = "rightmonth" tagFinalThisButton = tuple((tagBaseButton,tagThisButton)) self.fnCreateRightArrow(self.canvas, x,y, tagFinalThisButton) #Print days self.canvas.create_text(150,90, text=strdays, font=fnta) self.canvas.pack (expand =1, fill =tk.BOTH) self.canvas.tag_bind ("Arrow", "<ButtonRelease-1>", self.fnClick) self.canvas.tag_bind ("Arrow", "<Enter>", self.fnOnMouseOver) self.canvas.tag_bind ("Arrow", "<Leave>", self.fnOnMouseOut) self.fnFillCalendar()
def fnCreateRightArrow(self, canv, x, y, strtagname): canv.create_polygon(x,y, [[x+0,y-5], [x+10, y-5] , [x+10,y-10] , [x+20,y+0], [x+10,y+10] , [x+10,y+5] , [x+0,y+5]], tags = strtagname , fill="blue", width=0)
def fnCreateLeftArrow(self, canv, x, y, strtagname): canv.create_polygon(x,y, [[x+10,y-10], [x+10, y-5] , [x+20,y-5] , [x+20,y+5], [x+10,y+5] , [x+10,y+10] ], tags = strtagname , fill="blue", width=0)
def fnClick(self,event): owntags =self.canvas.gettags(tk.CURRENT) if "rightyear" in owntags: intyear = int(self.year_var.get()) intyear +=1 stryear = str(intyear) self.year_var.set(stryear) if "leftyear" in owntags: intyear = int(self.year_var.get()) intyear -=1 stryear = str(intyear) self.year_var.set(stryear) if "rightmonth" in owntags: if self.intmonth < 12 : self.intmonth += 1 strnummonth = str(self.intmonth) strmonth = dictmonths[strnummonth] self.month_var.set(strmonth) else : self.intmonth = 1 strnummonth = str(self.intmonth) strmonth = dictmonths[strnummonth] self.month_var.set(strmonth) intyear = int(self.year_var.get()) intyear +=1 stryear = str(intyear) self.year_var.set(stryear) if "leftmonth" in owntags: if self.intmonth > 1 : self.intmonth -= 1 strnummonth = str(self.intmonth) strmonth = dictmonths[strnummonth] self.month_var.set(strmonth) else : self.intmonth = 12 strnummonth = str(self.intmonth) strmonth = dictmonths[strnummonth] self.month_var.set(strmonth) intyear = int(self.year_var.get()) intyear -=1 stryear = str(intyear) self.year_var.set(stryear) self.fnFillCalendar()
def fnFillCalendar(self): init_x_pos = 70 arr_y_pos = [110,130,150,170,190,210] intposarr = 0 self.canvas.delete("DayButton") self.canvas.update() intyear = int(self.year_var.get()) monthcal = calendar.monthcalendar(intyear, self.intmonth) for row in monthcal: xpos = init_x_pos ypos = arr_y_pos[intposarr] for item in row: stritem = str(item) if stritem == "0": xpos += 27 else : tagNumber = tuple((self.tagBaseNumber,stritem)) self.canvas.create_text(xpos, ypos , text=stritem, font=fnta,tags=tagNumber) xpos += 27 intposarr += 1 self.canvas.tag_bind ("DayButton", "<ButtonRelease-1>", self.fnClickNumber) self.canvas.tag_bind ("DayButton", "<Enter>", self.fnOnMouseOver) self.canvas.tag_bind ("DayButton", "<Leave>", self.fnOnMouseOut)
def fnClickNumber(self,event): owntags =self.canvas.gettags(tk.CURRENT) for x in owntags: if (x == "current") or (x == "DayButton"): pass else : strdate = "{}-{:0>2}-{:0>2}".format(str(self.year_var.get()),str(self.intmonth),str(x)) self.update_var.set(strdate) self.update_cmd(strdate)
def fnOnMouseOver(self,event): self.canvas.move(tk.CURRENT, 1, 1) self.canvas.update()
def fnOnMouseOut(self,event): self.canvas.move(tk.CURRENT, -1, -1) self.canvas.update()
# END CLASS ##############################################
class clsMainFrame(tk.Frame): def __init__(self, master): self.parent = master tk.Frame.__init__(master) self.date_var = tk.StringVar() self.date_var.set(strdate) self.work = tk.Canvas(master, width =ATKwidth, height =ATKheight, relief =tk.RIDGE, background ="white", borderwidth =1) self.work.pack(side="top") label = tk.Label(master, textvariable= self.date_var, bg = "white") label.pack(side="top") self.cal = tkCalendar(master, year, month, day, self.date_var, self.update_cmd) exitBtn = tk.Button(master, text = 'Exit', command = master.quit) exitBtn.pack(side = 'right')
def update_cmd(self, date): self.work.delete('all') jobs = [] times = [] numJobs = 0 try: jobf = open(pathToData + "projects.txt") for job in jobf: job = job.strip() jobs.append(job) numJobs = numJobs + 1 times.append(getJobTime(job,date))
width = ATKwidth/numJobs bottomline = ATKheight - 8 topOffset = 8 botomHeight = ATKheight for colnum in range(1,numJobs+1): mn = times[colnum-1]/60 hr = mn/60 mn = mn - (60*hr) jtime = "{}:{:0>2}".format(hr,mn) columnStart = int((1.0-((hr+(mn/60.0))/maxHour))*ATKheight) self.work.create_rectangle(((colnum-1)*width), columnStart, (width*colnum), botomHeight, fill="blue") self.work.create_text(((width/2) + ((colnum-1)*width)),bottomline,text=jobs[colnum-1], fill="white") self.work.create_text(((width/2) + ((colnum-1)*width)),(columnStart+topOffset),text=jtime, fill="white") except IOError: pass
root =tk.Tk() root.title ("Time Sheet") Frm = tk.Frame(root) clsMainFrame(Frm) Frm.pack() root.mainloop()
Add a new project to track time.
